image.alt: Smiling patients receiving friendly orthodontic care

paragraphs.text: Welcome to Hutta Orthodontic Specialists. We strive to provide high‑quality care and friendly service that create happier, healthier smiles. Our board‑certified orthodontists, Dr. J. Lawrence Hutta and Dr. Pegah Kamrani, lead a team committed to a warm, welcoming environment and expert-level care. We personalize every treatment using advanced technology, continuing education, and a patient‑first philosophy so each person receives the most effective, safe, and beautiful result for their unique smile.

items.title: A Legacy of Excellence
items.text: Decades of local experience and a strong community reputation for producing confident, healthy, and aesthetic smiles.

items.title: Board‑Certified Doctors
items.text: Board certification and ongoing advanced training keep our doctors current with the safest, most effective orthodontic techniques.

items.title: Personalized Treatment
items.text: In‑house 3D imaging, custom planning, and modern appliance options deliver precise, efficient care tailored to you.

items.title: Compassionate Care
items.text: We emphasize patient comfort, clear communication, and a family-first approach so every visit feels welcoming.

paragraphs.text: Dr. J. Lawrence Hutta, D.D.S., Diplomate, American Board of Orthodontics, is a respected clinician and educator. He completed dental and orthodontic training and teaches at The Ohio State University College of Dentistry. Known for advanced clinical skill and a patient-centered approach, Dr. Hutta leads the practice with a focus on predictable results and compassionate care.

Dr. Pegah Kamrani, D.D.S., is a board‑certified orthodontist with advanced training including dental and orthodontic residency programs at leading institutions. Inspired by her own treatment experience, she brings a thoughtful, patient-centered approach to braces, early treatment, and clear aligner care.

Dr. Malika Sachdev, M.S., is an orthodontist with specialized training in facial esthetics and interdisciplinary care. With a Master of Science in Orthodontics and a compassionate approach, she focuses on clear communication and personalized treatment for patients of all ages.
We offer a full range of orthodontic options, from advanced braces systems to clear aligners and custom in‑house solutions to fit different needs and lifestyles.

testimonials.author: Bonnie F.
testimonials.testimonial: “I had a great experience with my aligners. The results were fantastic and they were really very easy to adjust to. The Worthington office and Dr. Hutta we’re all very knowledgeable and professional! Would highly recommend this office!”

testimonials.author: Simone O.
testimonials.testimonial: “We love Dr. Hutta. Everyone, we have met so far was great. Our daughter is fairly young and was very timid at the beginning. They took away all her fear. She especially loves Mrs. Shanna. They have a great incentive point system for on time arrival, good hygiene etc! Would recommend to anyone needing ortho work!!!”

testimonials.author: Sheila G.
testimonials.testimonial: “Everyone in the entire office is pleasant and knowledgeable! I was a much older patient having braces put on and was treated so well. ... The change in my teeth and smile has been amazing! I am very grateful.”

og_meta.title: Home - Hutta Orthodontic Specialists
og_meta.description: Hutta Orthodontic Specialists provides advanced, compassionate orthodontic care in Worthington, Ohio.

image.alt: Smiling orthodontic team in a modern bright office

paragraphs.text: Welcome to Hutta Orthodontic Specialists. Thank you for taking the time to get to know our practice, mission, and the team who create our patients’ healthy smiles. Led by board‑certified orthodontists Dr. J. Lawrence Hutta and Dr. Pegah Kamrani, we are a family practice with a passion for orthodontic care and a long-standing legacy in the Columbus area.

Our goal is to help patients of all ages achieve the smiles they deserve with expert, friendly care. We combine advanced technology such as digital scanning, 3D printing, and custom appliance workflows with ongoing education to deliver personalized treatment plans rather than one-size-fits-all care.
We create beautiful, healthy smiles that last a lifetime by delivering individualized care, investing in advanced orthodontic technology, and treating every patient like family.

Dr. Hutta is one of the most celebrated orthodontists in the Midwest, known for his dedication to outstanding results and a thoughtful, patient-centered approach. Tens of thousands of families have trusted their smiles to his care, and he regularly teaches and lectures to dentists and orthodontists across the country and internationally.
He serves on the faculty at The Ohio State University College of Dentistry and brings decades of clinical experience to every case, blending advanced techniques with a calm, reassuring manner.

Dr. Hutta graduated cum laude from The Ohio State University College of Dentistry and completed a general dental residency followed by a graduate orthodontics program at the University of Rochester School of Dentistry/Eastman Institute for Oral Health.
He is a Diplomate of the American Board of Orthodontics and an active member of the American Association of Orthodontists, the Ohio Dental Association, and the Columbus Dental Society.

A proud supporter of local schools, Dr. Hutta offers scholarships to deserving high school graduates and is deeply involved in community initiatives. He is the father of three daughters and enjoys OSU athletics, golf, and family time when not in the office.

Dr. Kamrani is a board‑certified orthodontist who brings a patient-centered approach shaped by her own experience as an orthodontic patient. She focuses on delivering personalized care for children, teens, and adults using the latest techniques.

Dr. Kamrani studied neuroscience at Columbia University and earned her DDS from the University of North Carolina Adams School of Dentistry. She completed her orthodontic residency and master's degree at The Ohio State University.
An avid runner who trains for marathons, Dr. Kamrani enjoys spending time with family and friends. She brings energy and positivity to the office and looks forward to serving the Columbus community.

Dr. Sachdev is a dedicated orthodontist with strong interests in facial esthetics and interdisciplinary care. She emphasizes patient communication and comfort while using the latest clinical techniques.

Dr. Sachdev completed her undergraduate and dental degrees at the University of Michigan, graduating magna cum laude with distinction, and earned her orthodontic residency and MS in Orthodontics from the University of Detroit Mercy.

Fluent in English, Hindi, and Punjabi, Dr. Sachdev enjoys traveling, trying new restaurants, Pilates, and pickleball. She is known for clear communication and a warm manner that helps patients feel comfortable throughout treatment.

slides.alt: Our team in the reception area
Committed to continuing education and modern technology

paragraphs.text: Over the years, Hutta Orthodontic Specialists has helped thousands of local residents achieve healthier, more confident smiles. We support Columbus schools and offer scholarships to outstanding high school graduates as part of our ongoing commitment to education and opportunity.
Giving back is part of who we are, and we take pride in serving local organizations and families across the community.

image.alt: Patient smiling after orthodontic treatment in Columbus, Ohio

Get Started.title: What to expect at your first visit

paragraphs.text: Your first visit begins with a comprehensive exam, including necessary X-rays and photos. We’ll do a full oral evaluation and then meet with you one-on-one to discuss findings and answer questions.

We review your medical history, outline recommended treatment options such as Invisalign<sup>®</sup> or braces, and create a customized plan. Bring your ID and insurance information to help us streamline your visit.
We accept most major insurance plans and will file claims electronically to make your visit easier. Our team can estimate benefits and answer questions about coverage at your consultation.
Flexible financing plans are available to fit a range of budgets. To request a consultation, call (614) 885-2000 or visit https://huttasmiles.com/contact/ to schedule online.

Complete your new patient paperwork online before your visit to save time. Our Request an Appointment form collects basic details including first and last name and a phone number with a country code selector.
Visit our contact page to access the appointment form and any printable forms we provide. If you prefer help, call (614) 885-2000 and our team will guide you through the next steps.

image.alt: Patient completing new patient forms online

image.alt: Smiling patients of all ages at Lakeshore Orthodontics

paragraphs.text: Damon self‑ligating braces use a low‑friction system that reduces the need for elastic ties and frequent tightening. That often means fewer in‑office adjustments, a more comfortable daily experience, and an efficient path to a healthier, aligned smile.

image.alt: Two stylish smiling teens taking selfie with braces

paragraphs.text: Insignia offers a fully customized approach: high‑precision scanning and bespoke appliances tailored to each tooth. That customization can shorten treatment time and improve comfort by delivering forces exactly where they’re needed.

We design and print custom clear aligners in‑office using advanced 3D imaging. In‑house production gives faster turnaround, lower costs, and the flexibility to remake trays quickly when needed so treatment stays on track.

image.alt: Close-up of Invisalign aligners being placed on teeth

paragraphs.text: Invisalign<sup>®</sup> clear aligners are a nearly invisible option for many adults. Most patients wear each tray for one to two weeks and should aim for at least 22 hours of wear per day for reliable results.
Whether choosing Invisalign<sup>®</sup> or a custom printed option, our team uses 3D planning to design comfortable trays and guide predictably toward your new smile.

image.alt: Close-up of Invisalign aligners being placed on teeth

paragraphs.text: We evaluate jaw function and, when appropriate, offer TMJ appliances, custom splints, and coordinated care to reduce pain, improve bite balance, and restore comfortable jaw movement.

image.alt: Orthodontic patient receiving orthognathic surgical consultation

paragraphs.text: After active treatment we design a retention plan to protect your new smile. Custom removable and fixed retainers help maintain alignment and long‑term stability.
We’ll recommend the retainer type and wear schedule that fits your needs so your results last a lifetime.

image.alt: Beautiful young Asian woman smiling and holding orthodontic retainer

paragraphs.text: Early evaluation by age seven lets us spot growth concerns and guide jaw development. Timely intervention can simplify later treatment and sometimes avoid extractions or more invasive care.

image.alt: Young patient receiving early orthodontic intervention

paragraphs.text: Adults benefit from modern orthodontics just as much as younger patients. We offer discreet options, including clear brackets, Insignia customization, Damon systems, and clear aligners to fit professional and busy lifestyles.

paragraphs.text: When it comes to orthodontics, treatment, or retention, you may have questions. Read on for answers to our most frequently asked questions!

Orthodontics is a specialized field of dentistry that focuses on diagnosing, preventing, and treating dental and facial abnormalities. A person might have crooked teeth, an overbite, an underbite, or crowding that can cause problems with eating or speaking. With orthodontic treatment, the position of a person’s teeth and bite can be corrected for both cosmetic and health benefits.

Everyone has different goals, anatomy, and health profiles, which means that everyone has a different treatment plan. During your consultation, your orthodontist will go over your specific timeline to make your smile as healthy as possible.

accordion.header: Will braces interfere with extracurriculars, like playing sports or a musical instrument?

paragraphs.text: While there may be a slight adjustment period, fortunately, braces and aligners should not impact your ability to play an instrument or a sport. If you do play a sport, make sure to always wear a mouth guard to protect your smile.

An orthodontist is a specialist in the field of dentistry. After completing dental school, orthodontists go on for an additional two to three years of graduate training in orthodontics. Orthodontists diagnose and correct misaligned teeth and bites, which could cause greater health problems if left untreated.

accordion.header: What can you eat with braces?

paragraphs.text: Your diet should not change dramatically with braces, but you should be mindful of what you eat. It can be easy for foods to get caught in the wires, so it is best to avoid foods like popcorn where pieces are likely to get trapped in hard-to-reach places. You should also avoid sticky and chewy foods, such as gum or hard candies. This will ensure that braces’ bands, wires, and brackets remain firmly in place. To avoid staining or decay, always brush and floss after eating or drinking. When you first get braces, your mouth may feel a little sore. Soft foods like mashed potatoes or soups may be easier to eat for your first days with appliances.

With dramatic technical advancements in orthodontics, having braces is easier and more comfortable than ever. When you first get your braces, you may feel some minor discomfort from the slight pressure that helps your teeth move. But braces should not be painful. If you are experiencing serious pain with your braces, contact your orthodontist immediately. For minor discomfort, your orthodontist will give you wax to place over areas that may experience a little irritation as your gums, lips, and cheeks adjust to the new appliances.

Since treatments vary based on each patient’s needs, the cost of treatment also varies. At your consultation, your orthodontist will talk you through pricing estimates based on your specific treatment. Check out our payment options to learn more about financing options: https://huttasmiles.com/payment-options/

accordion.header: What will my smile look like?

paragraphs.text: Although every patient and treatment are different, our team’s years of experience at Hutta Orthodontic Specialists means that we have probably seen cases very similar to yours. Check out our smile gallery to see before and after shots and ask your doctor to show you a reference photo of someone with a similar smile: https://huttasmiles.com/smile-gallery/

accordion.header: What is the best age to see an orthodontist?

paragraphs.text: At age 7, it is recommended to first see an orthodontist. At this age, the orthodontist will be able to check on the progression of a child’s growth and treat any emerging orthodontic problems. By addressing orthodontic issues early, you avoid problems worsening with age or complicating a child’s development.

accordion.header: How do you take care of your teeth during treatment?

paragraphs.text: It is very important to take careful care of your teeth with braces or with other orthodontic appliances. It is easy for plaque to build up in the nooks and crannies of your mouth. Not only is there a higher risk for cavities and staining to develop, but not taking care of your teeth could lengthen your treatment time. You should brush your teeth and floss after every meal or snack. If you have a retainer, make sure to keep it clean by regularly brushing it gently with a toothbrush and toothpaste.
